name: John
content:
Slapshot is pretty hard, but also very rewarding. It may take 10 or more hours of experience to figure out the basics of puck handling. Nevertheless, pulling off a nice backhander or deking past an opposing defender feels great, and is well worth the effort put into learning those moves.

For the price of free, the game is definitely worth checking out. A high skill floor plus a high skill ceiling makes for an intense and entertaining multiplayer experience.

name: Jane
content: It's not a "bad game". It just takes a lot to get used to,and with so few players I kept finding myself being matched up 1v1 with a player with obvious skill an experience. A player base will never expand if new players can't learn how to play without being forced to go against players with loads of practice. I'd recommend the game just for more newer players to play with,but I don't see myself returning often,if ever.

name: Mark
content: this game changed my life. before slapshot, i had nothing. Now I have nothing but the pride knowing im a slap god
